IX.iii.1.G.3.s
.
Adaptive Equipment
Payments for adaptive devices or service animals, including veterinary care, used to assist a person with an ongoing disability are medical expenses.
Do
not
allow a medical expense deduction for equipment that would normally be used by a nondisabled person, such as an air conditioner or automatic transmission.
Note
:  Medical expenses do not include non-prescription food, boarding, grooming, or other routine expenses of owning an animal.
Reference
:  For more information on medical expenses for VA purposes see
38 CFR 3.278(c)
.
